verses.verse: And he commanded<WH6680> <WH853> the steward<WH834> <WH5921> of his house,<WH1004> saying,<WH559> Fill<WH4390> <WH853> the men's<WH376> sacks<WH572> with food,<WH400> as much as<WH834> they can<WH3201> carry,<WH5375> and put<WH7760> every man's<WH376> money<WH3701> in his sack's<WH572> mouth.<WH6310>

And put<WH7760> my cup,<WH1375> the silver<WH3701> cup,<WH1375> in the sack's<WH572> mouth<WH6310> of the youngest,<WH6996> and his corn<WH7668> money.<WH3701> And he did<WH6213> according to the word<WH1697> that<WH834> Joseph<WH3130> had spoken.<WH1696>
As soon as the morning<WH1242> was light,<WH215> the men<WH376> were sent away,<WH7971> they<WH1992> and their asses.<WH2543>

And when they<WH1992> were gone out of<WH3318> <WH853> the city,<WH5892> and not<WH3808> yet far off,<WH7368> Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto his steward,<WH834> <WH5921> <WH1004> Up,<WH6965> follow<WH7291> after<WH310> the men;<WH376> and when thou dost overtake<WH5381> them, say<WH559> unto<WH413> them, Wherefore<WH4100> have ye rewarded<WH7999> evil<WH7451> for<WH8478> good?<WH2896>
Is not<WH3808> this<WH2088> it in which<WH834> my lord<WH113> drinketh,<WH8354> and whereby indeed he divineth?<WH1931> <WH5172> <WH5172> ye have done evil<WH7489> in so<WH834> doing.<WH6213>
And he overtook<WH5381> them, and he spoke<WH1696> unto<WH413> them<WH853> these same<WH428> words.<WH1697>

And they said<WH559> unto<WH413> him, Wherefore<WH4100> saith<WH1696> my lord<WH113> these<WH428> words?<WH1697> God forbid<WH2486> that thy servants<WH5650> should do<WH4480> <WH6213> according to this<WH2088> thing: <WH1697>

Behold, <WH2005> the money,<WH3701> which<WH834> we found<WH4672> in our sacks'<WH572> mouths,<WH6310> we brought again<WH7725> unto<WH413> thee out of the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Canaan:<WH3667> how<WH349> then should we steal<WH1589> out of thy lord's house<WH4480> <WH1004> <WH113> silver<WH3701> or<WH176> gold?<WH2091>
With <WH854> whomsoever<WH834> of thy servants<WH4480> <WH5650> it be found,<WH4672> both let him die,<WH4191> and we<WH587> also<WH1571> will be<WH1961> my lord's<WH113> bondmen.<WH5650>

And he said,<WH559> Now<WH6258> also<WH1571> <WH3651> let it<WH1931> be according unto your words:<WH1697> he with<WH854> whom<WH834> it is found<WH4672> shall be<WH1961> my servant;<WH5650> and ye<WH859> shall be<WH1961> blameless.<WH5355>
Then they speedily<WH4116> took down<WH3381> every man<WH376> <WH853> his sack<WH572> to the ground,<WH776> and opened<WH6605> every man<WH376> his sack.<WH572>
And he searched,<WH2664> and began<WH2490> at the eldest,<WH1419> and left<WH3615> at the youngest:<WH6996> and the cup<WH1375> was found<WH4672> in Benjamin's<WH1144> sack.<WH572>
Then they rent<WH7167> their clothes,<WH8071> and laded<WH6006> every man<WH376> his ass,<WH2543> and returned<WH7725> to the city.<WH5892>
And Judah<WH3063> and his brethren<WH251> came<WH935> to Joseph's<WH3130> house;<WH1004> for he<WH1931> was yet<WH5750> there:<WH8033> and they fell<WH5307> before<WH6440> him on the ground.<WH776>

And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto them, What<WH4100> deed<WH4639> is this<WH2088> that<WH834> ye have done?<WH6213> know<WH3045> ye not<WH3808> that<WH3588> such a man<WH376> as I<WH3644> can certainly divine?<WH5172> <WH5172>

And Judah<WH3063> said,<WH559> What<WH4100> shall we say<WH559> unto my lord?<WH113> what<WH4100> shall we speak?<WH1696> or how<WH4100> shall we clear ourselves?<WH6663> God<WH430> hath found out<WH4672> <WH853> the iniquity<WH5771> of thy servants:<WH5650> behold,<WH2009> we are my lord's<WH113> servants,<WH5650> both<WH1571> we,<WH587> and he also<WH1571> with whom<WH834> <WH3027> the cup<WH1375> is found.<WH4672>

And he said,<WH559> God forbid<WH2486> that I should do<WH4480> <WH6213> so:<WH2063> but the man<WH376> in whose<WH834> hand<WH3027> the cup<WH1375> is found,<WH4672> he<WH1931> shall be<WH1961> my servant;<WH5650> and as for you,<WH859> get you up<WH5927> in peace<WH7965> unto<WH413> your father.<WH1>

Then Judah<WH3063> came near<WH5066> unto him,<WH413> and said,<WH559> Oh<WH994> my lord,<WH113> let thy servant,<WH5650> I pray thee,<WH4994> speak<WH1696> a word<WH1697> in my lord's<WH113> ears,<WH241> and let not<WH408> thine anger<WH639> burn<WH2734> against thy servant:<WH5650> for<WH3588> thou art even as<WH3644> Pharaoh.<WH6547>
My lord<WH113> asked<WH7592> <WH853> his servants,<WH5650> saying,<WH559> Have<WH3426> ye a father,<WH1> or<WH176> a brother?<WH251>

And we said<WH559> unto<WH413> my lord,<WH113> We have<WH3426> a father,<WH1> an old man,<WH2205> and a child<WH3206> of his old age,<WH2208> a little one;<WH6996> and his brother<WH251> is dead,<WH4191> and he<WH1931> alone<WH905> is left<WH3498> of his mother,<WH517> and his father<WH1> loveth<WH157> him.
And thou saidst<WH559> unto<WH413> thy servants,<WH5650> Bring him down<WH3381> unto<WH413> me, that I may set<WH7760> mine eyes<WH5869> upon<WH5921> him.

And we said<WH559> unto<WH413> my lord,<WH113> The lad<WH5288> cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> leave<WH5800> <WH853> his father:<WH1> for if he should leave<WH5800> <WH853> his father,<WH1> his father would die.<WH4191>

And thou saidst<WH559> unto<WH413> thy servants,<WH5650> Except<WH518> <WH3808> your youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> come down<WH3381> with<WH854> you, ye shall see<WH7200> my face<WH6440> no<WH3808> more.<WH3254>
And it came to pass<WH1961> when<WH3588> we came up<WH5927> unto<WH413> thy servant<WH5650> my father,<WH1> we told<WH5046> him<WH853> the words<WH1697> of my lord.<WH113>
And our father<WH1> said,<WH559> Go again,<WH7725> and buy<WH7666> us a little<WH4592> food.<WH400>

And we said,<WH559> We cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> go down:<WH3381> if<WH518> our youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> be<WH3426> with<WH854> us, then will we go down:<WH3381> for<WH3588> we may<WH3201> not<WH3808> see<WH7200> the man's<WH376> face,<WH6440> except<WH369> our youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> be with<WH854> us.
And thy servant<WH5650> my father<WH1> said<WH559> unto<WH413> us, Ye<WH859> know<WH3045> that<WH3588> my wife<WH802> bore<WH3205> me two<WH8147> sons:
And the one<WH259> went out<WH3318> from<WH4480> <WH854> me, and I said,<WH559> Surely<WH389> he is torn in pieces;<WH2963> <WH2963> and I saw<WH7200> him not<WH3808> since:<WH5704> <WH2008>

And if ye take<WH3947> <WH853> this<WH2088> also<WH1571> from<WH4480> <WH5973> me,<WH6440> and mischief<WH611> befall<WH7136> him, ye shall bring down<WH3381> <WH853> my gray hairs<WH7872> with sorrow<WH7451> to the grave.<WH7585>

Now <WH6258> therefore when I come<WH935> to<WH413> thy servant<WH5650> my father,<WH1> and the lad<WH5288> be not<WH369> with<WH854> us; seeing that his life<WH5315> is bound up<WH7194> in the lad's life;<WH5315>

It shall come to pass,<WH1961> when he seeth<WH7200> that<WH3588> the lad<WH5288> is not<WH369> with us, that he will die:<WH4191> and thy servants<WH5650> shall bring down<WH3381> <WH853> the gray hairs<WH7872> of thy servant<WH5650> our father<WH1> with sorrow<WH3015> to the grave.<WH7585>

For <WH3588> thy servant<WH5650> became surety<WH6148> for<WH853> the lad<WH5288> unto<WH4480> <WH5973> my father,<WH1> saying,<WH559> If<WH518> I bring<WH935> him not<WH3808> unto<WH413> thee, then I shall bear the blame<WH2398> to my father<WH1> forever.<WH3605> <WH3117>

Now <WH6258> therefore, I pray thee,<WH4994> let thy servant<WH5650> abide<WH3427> instead of<WH8478> the lad<WH5288> a bondman<WH5650> to my lord;<WH113> and let the lad<WH5288> go up<WH5927> with<WH5973> his brethren.<WH251>

For <WH3588> how<WH349> shall I go up<WH5927> to<WH413> my father,<WH1> and the lad<WH5288> be not<WH369> with<WH854> me? lest peradventure<WH6435> I see<WH7200> the evil<WH7451> that<WH834> shall come on<WH4672> <WH853> my father.<WH1>
